comments:
I created a dynamic web project following the instructions here:
http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/jsf/dev_resource/JSFTutorial-RC3/JSFTools_tutorial.html

The difference is instead of deploying the jars into my WEB-INF/lib directory I have them in my tomcat common/lib and common/endorsed dirs. I also chose not to deploy any of these jars since they were already in tomcat (v5.5). Another difference I set the JSF configuration file to jsftest/jsfconfig/faces-config.xml.

The project appears to get setup fine but when I open the faces-config.xml I get the following error:

Unable to create this part due to an internal error. Reason for the failure: An unexpected exception was thrown.

I view the details and see:

Created an attachment (id=53547)
Directory Structure of my project after it is created

Perhaps this will help in duplicating the issue. It appears that there are to faces-config.xml files in my WebContent directory. Perhaps something was setup wrong. Thanks for all you hard work, I am really starting to like eclipse.

When you created the dynamic web project did you specify the web content folder name you wanted in the wizard?  It looks as though WebContent is configured as your web root.  Adding the JSF facet in the New Web Project folder automatically adds a faces-config.xml and web.xml to your web content folder.

I am able to load the two faces-configs under the WebContent folder.

Also note that if you don't put your jar dependencies on the class path your code will probably not compile.

Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.
